messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:25): from the IRI meeting
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:26): "4. Next steps: Larry: let's see if we can get more attendees & agenda items for next interim meeting."
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:28): sounds like a useful meeting
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:28): aren't they all

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:29): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: re http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=10419#c7 , value->defaultValue has proven really unpopular, which is why i am skeptical of doing it for that one
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:29): what i really want is an attribute where we can stick all the "initial state" stuff
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:29): default playback rate, volume, muted... except only support muted for now
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:30): i guess autoplay is already its own thing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:30): and automute doesn't really sound right
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:31): i dunno, having to type defaultmuted="" defaultvolume="0.5" defaultplaybackrate="2" seems more annoying than muted="" volume="0.5" playbackrate="2"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:31): i agree
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:31): not sure what to do
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:31): pointers to defaultValue unpopularity?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:31): (would it be less unpopular if the attribute was called defaultvalue=""?)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:32): search for "The HTML DOM got this very wrong" in http://lists.whatwg.org/htdig.cgi/whatwg-whatwg.org/2010-September/028755.html
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:33): it would be less unpopular with sicking if value="" was the default value and editing muted the DOM
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:33): i'm not personally convinced that's great either though
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:33): mutated
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:33): not muted :-)

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:35): the other thing is that this isn't an attribute whose values are "muted" and "not muted", it's an attribute whose values are "mute initially in all cases" and "use the user's default for this video"
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:35): foolip: what do you think? ^
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:35): so "muted" isn't necessarily the most obvious name
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:35): it should also be pointed out that a lot of people don't think we should have the mute/volume state be remembered on a per-video basis
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:36): from the author's perspective, he mutes the video if he adds the attribute

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:36): and that instead we should have a browser-level mute (maybe per tab) that can't be controlled by JS, and that video.muted should only be the author override for the video

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:37): but that would make the video's mute indicator and the system mute indicator not be the only indicators of relevance, instead adding at least one more to the mix
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:37): it seems end users would want to mute a video, but not necessarily want to unmute it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:37): which i'm not sure is a good idea
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:37): end users?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:37): or authors?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:37): so having muted just be an author thing seems fine to me
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:38): forgot .muted currently reflects the end user setting
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:38): i almost never want videos muted personally, if i want audio off i want all audio off and turn it off at the system level
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:38): yeah me too
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:38): I think .muted should just turn into an author setting
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:39): like it is for Flash video as well

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:39): i'd love a "this tab is a source of sound" indicator, but i don't think i care about turning the sound off at that level (though a shortcut to override all the <video> elements on the page in one go mighht be ok)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:39): mute control on youtube can say it should give sound, but I often have it turned off system wide anyway
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (11:39): sometimes, I want to mute manually
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:39): i don't understand, are you saying that .muted should not reflect the muted indicator you get from controls=""?
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (11:40): when a website is playing a sound and I can't figure out how to stop it
4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9 (11:41): I'd like browsers to provide some UI to find which tabs are currently playing some sound
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:41): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: on a second thought, maybe it's not so bad to just mutate the dom
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:42): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, I guess in that case mutating the DOM might be ok, though I am not sure
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:43): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, for <details> UAs could remember the state too which would mutate the DOM

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:43): i think mutating the dom would be really weird for the reason given by the CSS example I gave in http://lists.whatwg.org/htdig.cgi/whatwg-whatwg.org/2010-September/028755.html
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:43): (that problem isn't such a big deal for <details>)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:44): why is it weird? if the author wants special styling for muted videos, it makes sense to have video[muted] match when the video is muted
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:44): isn't it the same problem for <details>?

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:45): author assumes it is open/closed but it's the other way around based on earlier interaction (or maybe a preference/extension that expands all those controls by default)

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:51): i would expect a difference because an author might have a bunch of muted videos that are always muted, and he uses that as a hook for styling them differently from the main video that isn't muted
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:51): e.g. imagine if the small poster frames on a youtube page were all live <video>s
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:51): muted ones
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:51): and they were made small because all muted videos were small

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:52): that's different than <details> and [open] because the most likely reason to style [open] is that you're trying to do something for when it's open vs when it's not
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:52): but i agree that this argument is weak

cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:52): it seems stupid to hook that styling off muted="", and anyway youtube would want to use a different video stream for those to save bandwidth, and could just remove the audio stream altogether and not bother with muted=""
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:53): yeah i'm not saying it'd be a good idea
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:54): what if the author only has the main video and wants to style it specially when it's muted
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:54): we could introduce :muted for that, but having [muted] just work is simpler
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:55): that argues for exposing the entire API in content attributes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:55): i'm not sure that's a reasonable line of argumentation
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:56): fwiw, flash apparently makes a mess of this particular issue (muting by default), so they're not useful as inspiration here.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:57): the styling would only be affected if the user agent remembered the muted settings, I wonder how likely such a scenario is
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:58): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: it seems like better user experience to remember the mute setting on reload
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:59): is it worth the trouble?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:00): however, having muted and .defaultMuted also works for me
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:01): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 is right that defaultmuted="" is kinda ugly
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:04): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: remembering checkbox states is apparently worth the trouble
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:05): although a form taken together can take a long time to fill, while muting a video is trivial
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:05): i'm not an UX guy :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:08): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, I meant following the <input value> design
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:08): ah
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:08): sicking would hate that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:08): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, sicking is right that it's not nice, but it would be internally consistent and somewhat predictable
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:09): and not give weird DOM stuff
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:09): thinks that remembering mute state may be more important for some settings than remembering checked state, btw :-)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:09): (though in the case of <details> it would require a pseudo-class of some kind to be introduced)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:09): yeah, <details> is kind of my experiment in this space
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:09): i want to see what authors think of the straight-DOM-mutation design
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:13): seems bad to ship 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e experiments with known bad design that are impossible to revert later on
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:13): if it is bad design
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:13): can't we already test this since some versions of ie mutate the dom?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:14): well it's not known bad, that's the point
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:14): the IE experiment suggested it might be good, but was confused because authors were more annoyed with the lack of interop than either particular behaviour.
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:17): maybe we can get help from the html5 doctors here
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:17): post a simplequiz
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:17): Which Way Sucks Less?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:17): might be interesting
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:18): summons the doctors
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:18): that would certainly be interesting, but it's more the organic blog rants and how many pages use it and so on that i am interested in
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:19): e.g. finding how many people use [open] vs how many people detect onopen and set a class or whatnot
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:19): that would be a function of what works in existing browsers
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:19): yes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:20): it's a long-term experiment
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (12:20): so when we know the answer it's too late to change the feature
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:20): yeah, <details> is stuck this way forever.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (12:21): the point is to find out the results for future ideas.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:21): well, <details> is not stuck yet
